<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// On PowerPC target, we have two kinds of patterns related to FMA:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1: Improve ILP.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Try to reassociate FMA chains like below:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pattern 1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A =  FADD X,  Y          (Leaf)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   B =  FMA  A,  M21,  M22  (Prev)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   C =  FMA  B,  M31,  M32  (Root)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// --&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A =  FMA  X,  M21,  M22</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   B =  FMA  Y,  M31,  M32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   C =  FADD A,  B</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pattern 2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A =  FMA  X,  M11,  M12  (Leaf)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   B =  FMA  A,  M21,  M22  (Prev)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   C =  FMA  B,  M31,  M32  (Root)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// --&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A =  FMUL M11,  M12</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   B =  FMA  X,  M21,  M22</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   D =  FMA  A,  M31,  M32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   C =  FADD B,  D</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// breaking the dependency between A and B, allowing FMA to be executed in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// parallel (or back-to-back in a pipeline) instead of depending on each other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2: Reduce register pressure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Try to reassociate FMA with FSUB and a constant like below:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// C is a floating point const.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pattern 1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A = FSUB  X,  Y      (Leaf)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   D = FMA   B,  C,  A  (Root)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// --&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A = FMA   B,  Y,  -C</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   D = FMA   A,  X,  C</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Pattern 2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A = FSUB  X,  Y      (Leaf)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   D = FMA   B,  A,  C  (Root)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// --&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   A = FMA   B,  Y,  -C</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   D = FMA   A,  X,  C</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  Before the transformation, A must be assigned with different hardware</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  register with D. After the transformation, A and D must be assigned with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  same hardware register due to TIE attribute of FMA instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="349" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcinstrinfo/#a0df98b068b652d32c3529381db723b9c"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ppcinstrinfo/#a0df98b068b652d32c3529381db723b9c">PPCInstrInfo::getFMAPatterns</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp;Root,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="350"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;unsigned&gt;</a> &amp;Patterns,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3510"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3511"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ADDI instr: ToBeChangedReg = ADDI FrameBaseReg, OffsetAddi</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3513"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Imm instr:  Reg            = op OffsetImm, ToBeDeletedReg(killed)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03518" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3518"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Index instr:    Reg            = opx ScaleReg, ToBeChangedReg(killed)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3519"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3520"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// In order to eliminate ADD instr, make sure that:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3521"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1: (OffsetAddi + OffsetImm) must be int16 since this offset will be used in</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03523" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3523"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2: ToBeChangedReg must be killed in ADD instr and there is no other use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03524" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3524"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    between ADDI and ADD instr since its original def in ADDI will be changed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03525" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3525"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    in new ADDI instr. And also there should be no new def for it between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03526" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3526"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ADD and Imm instr as ToBeChangedReg will be used in Index instr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03527" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3527"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 3: ToBeDeletedReg must be killed in Imm instr and there is no other use</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03529" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3529"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 4: ScaleReg must not be redefined between ADD and Imm instr since it will be</span></CodeLine>
